This might be a dumb question but is time actually going faster? I did some research and mostly people have said that as you get older your brain doesn't have to process as much information as when you were younger because when you were younger you're just learning about the world and learning new experiences, but as you get older your brain has already experienced those things and that's why time seems to go by faster, because your brain doesn't have much new information to take in (sorry if I didn't explain this very well, but if you're into this kind of thing just look up "Time Perception" or something like that :P) but then I read on another website (I forgot where :/) that time really IS going faster, but by only a few milliseconds or something like that. So is time really getting faster? If it is just our brains perception, can we slow it down or speed it up?
